intro: Byttneria besalampensis, commonly known as the Besalampensian starleaf, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
